TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit DbFunctionsExtensions extends System.Object
public ref class DbFunctionsExtensions abstract sealed
public ref class DbFunctionsExtensions abstract sealed

Docs.summary: Provides CLR methods that get translated to database functions when used in LINQ to Entities queries. The methods on this class are accessed via .

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool Like (this Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.DbFunctions _, string matchExpression, string pattern);
.method public static hidebysig bool Like(class Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.DbFunctions _, string matchExpression, string pattern) cil managed
<Extension()> Public Function Like (_ As DbFunctions, matchExpression As String, pattern As String) As Boolean
static member Like : Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.DbFunctions * string * string -> bool

Docs.param: The string that is to be matched.
The pattern which may involve wildcards %,_,[,],^.

summary.para: An implementation of the SQL LIKE operation. On relational databases this is usually directly translated to SQL.

Note that if this function is translated into SQL, then the semantics of the comparison will depend on the database configuration. In particular, it may be either case-sensitive or case-insensitive. If this function is evaluated on the client, then it will always use a case-insensitive comparison.

Docs.returns: true if there is a match.

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool Like (this Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.DbFunctions _, string matchExpression, string pattern, string escapeCharacter);
.method public static hidebysig bool Like(class Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.DbFunctions _, string matchExpression, string pattern, string escapeCharacter) cil managed
<Extension()> Public Function Like (_ As DbFunctions, matchExpression As String, pattern As String, escapeCharacter As String) As Boolean
static member Like : Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.DbFunctions * string * string * string -> bool

Docs.param: The string that is to be matched.
The pattern which may involve wildcards %,_,[,],^.
The escape character (as a single character string) to use in front of %,_,[,],^ if they are not used as wildcards.

summary.para: An implementation of the SQL LIKE operation. On relational databases this is usually directly translated to SQL.

Note that if this function is translated into SQL, then the semantics of the comparison will depend on the database configuration. In particular, it may be either case-sensitive or case-insensitive. If this function is evaluated on the client, then it will always use a case-insensitive comparison.

Docs.returns: true if there is a match.
